page.title: 09Toryglen Gala
page.content: The Toryglen Gala is an annual event which last for three days in the month of June. It is organised by the Toryglen Community Centre. The proper name for the centre is the Geoff Shaw Centre. The Centre is called after Geoff Shaw who was a Strathclyde Regional Councillor who first started up community centres. Every year a Gala Queen is chosen from either the Primary Seven in our school (St. Brigid's) or Toryglen Primary School.The Queen has four attendants also chosen from the schools. During these three days there are different events such as competitions, parties and football matches. The biggest event is the Gala Concert at which the Gala Queen is crowned and the trophies are presented to the local football teams. The entertainment is provided by groups from the local schools.
